intro: Aethionema, commonly known as rock mustard, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, mat-forming shrubs that thrive in rocky or arid environments. They are characterized by their narrow, often hairy leaves and small, yellow or white flowers. Aethionema species are native to regions in Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate harsh growing conditions.
